alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Ritchie; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Pleasants, western Ritchie, northeastern Wirt and northeastern Wood Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boaz, or 7 miles east of Parkersburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Cairo, Schultz, Waverly, Pike, Freeport, Walker, Nutter Farm, Petroleum and Willow Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 176 and 185. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 9 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
